title: Understanding Option Greeks
description: Demystify the 'Greeks' (Delta, Gamma, Theta, Vega) to understand and manage the risks and rewards of options positions.
introduction: Option Greeks are mathematical measures that help traders understand how various factors affect the price of an option. They are essential tools for managing risk and making informed trading decisions.

delta.title: Delta: The Directional Risk
delta.p1: Delta measures how much an option's price changes for every ₹1 change in the underlying asset's price.

characteristics.callOptions: Call options have positive delta (0 to 1)
characteristics.putOptions: Put options have negative delta (-1 to 0)
characteristics.atTheMoney: At-the-money options have delta around 0.5 (calls) or -0.5 (puts)
characteristics.deepInTheMoney: Deep in-the-money options approach delta of 1.0 (calls) or -1.0 (puts)

gamma.title: Gamma: The Rate of Change
gamma.p1: Gamma measures how much delta changes for every ₹1 change in the underlying asset's price.

characteristics.atTheMoney: Gamma is highest for at-the-money options
characteristics.riskManagement: High gamma means delta can change rapidly, increasing risk

theta.title: Theta: The Time Decay
theta.p1: Theta measures how much an option's value decreases as time passes (time decay).

characteristics.alwaysNegative: Theta is always negative for long options
characteristics.acceleration: Time decay accelerates as expiration approaches

vega.title: Vega: The Volatility Risk
vega.p1: Vega measures how much an option's price changes for every 1% change in implied volatility.

characteristics.atTheMoney: Vega is highest for at-the-money options
characteristics.volatilityImpact: High vega means the option is sensitive to volatility changes

practicalApplications.title: Practical Applications
practicalApplications.use2: Choose the right options for your strategy

keyTakeaways.title: Key Takeaways
keyTakeaways.takeaway1: Delta measures directional risk and ranges from -1 to +1.
keyTakeaways.takeaway2: Gamma measures how quickly delta changes and is highest for at-the-money options.
keyTakeaways.takeaway3: Theta represents time decay and always works against long options.
keyTakeaways.takeaway4: Vega measures sensitivity to volatility changes and is highest for longer-term options.
